entries: When you manifest this power, you can increase its order by 1 to target one additional creature.

psionic.name: Witness Demise
entries: {@b Manifestation Time:} 1 action
{@b Range:} 30 feet
{@b Duration:} 1 minute
You project a mental image into the minds of up to three creatures you can see within range. Choose one of the following options, which affects all targets:

modes.name: Future Demise
entries: You show each target a possible death that they will experience far in the future, which is peaceful or heroic. For the duration, each target can't be {@condition frightened}, and has advantage on saving throws.

modes.name: Imminent Demise
entries: You show each target a possible death that they will experience imminently, which is violent or terrible. Each target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 8d8} psychic damage and is {@condition frightened} of you for the duration (save ends at end of turn). On a success, the target takes half as much damage and is not {@condition frightened}.

modes.name: Increased Order
entries: When you manifest this power, you can increase its order by 1 to target one additional creature.
Additionally, you can increase the power's order by 1 to increase the damage of the Imminent Demise option to {@damage 10d8}.

psionic.name: Ally of Time
entries: {@b Manifestation Time:} 1 action
{@b Range:} 120 feet (40-foot cube)
You alter time in a 40-foot cube within range for the duration. Whenever a creature starts their turn within the cube, you can choose one of the following effects (no action required):

modes.name: Accelerate
entries: Until the start of the target's next turn, their speed is doubled, they have a +2 bonus to AC, and they have advantage on Dexterity saving throws. The target gains an additional action that can be used only to take the {@action Attack} action (one weapon attack only), the {@action Cast a Spell} action (cantrip only), the {@action Manifest a Power|TalPsi} action (1st-order power only), or the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, {@action Hide}, or {@action Use an Object} actions.

modes.name: Decelerate
entries: The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or suffer the following effects until the start of their next turn: their speed is halved, they have a −2 penalty to AC, they have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and they can't use reactions. Additionally, the creature can take an action or a bonus action on their current turn, but not both, and can't make more than one attack regardless of features or magic items.

psionic.name: Brain Overload
entries: {@b Manifestation Time:} 1 action
{@b Range:} 120 feet
{@b Duration:} Instantaneous

modes.name: 6th-Order
entries: You unleash a sudden surge of energy in the mind of a creature you can see within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 14d10} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the target has a brain and this damage reduces them to 0 hit points, their brain explodes. (For a target with multiple brains, all their brains explode.) A target that can't survive without their brain or brains (as determined by the GM) dies instantly.

psionic.name: Concussive Wave
entries: {@b Manifestation Time:} 1 action
{@b Range:} 30 feet
{@b Duration:} Instantaneous

modes.name: 6th-Order
entries: You send forth a rising shockwave of telekinetic power. Each creature of your choice within range must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be thrown up to 90 feet vertically and up to 30 feet away from you. Each creature is then slammed to the ground, taking {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage per 10 feet fallen and landing {@condition prone}.

psionic.name: Crucible
entries: {@b Manifestation Time:} 1 action
{@b Range:} 150 feet (50-foot square)

modes.name: 6th-Order
entries: With the power of your mind, you ignite a 50-foot-square area that is 10 feet high and centered on a point on the ground that you can see within range. Each creature that starts their turn in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 7d10} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

At the start of each of your turns while the power is in effect, you can cause the fire to spread out 5 feet on all sides (no action required), expanding the area over any surface except for nonflammable liquid.
The fire damages objects in the area and ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried.

psionic.name: Fold Space
entries: {@b Manifestation Time:} 10 minutes
{@b Range:} 30 feet
{@b Duration:} 1 round

modes.name: 6th-Order
entries: You bend space to create a one-way pathway to a destination you select, which lasts until the end of your next turn. The opening of the pathway is a 10-foot-diameter circle that appears in an unoccupied space within range. Any creature that passes through the opening is transported to the destination.

The destination you choose can be on any plane of existence. It must be known to you, though you don't need to have visited it. The power fails if you select a destination that doesn't exist, such as a place you think you know that was actually an illusion, or a familiar location that has been destroyed.

psionic.name: Heat Transfer
entries: {@b Manifestation Time:} 1 action
{@b Range:} 120 feet

modes.name: 6th-Order
entries: You attempt to drain the warmth of life from a creature that isn't a Construct or Undead that you can see within range, then give that vitality to another. At the start of each of their turns, the target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 4d10} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Whenever the target takes cold damage from this power, you can choose another creature that isn't a Construct or Undead that you can see within range. That creature regains a number of hit points equal to half the cold damage dealt to the target.

psionic.name: Mass Choke
entries: {@b Manifestation Time:} 1 action
{@b Range:} 30 feet

modes.name: 6th-Order
entries: You attempt to lock your enemies in your telekinetic grip. Each creature of your choice that you can see within range must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition restrained} for the duration (save ends at end of turn). A creature {@condition restrained} in this way takes {@damage 5d8} force damage at the start of each of their turns. The power ends if the target is ever outside the power's range or if they have total cover from you.

psionic.name: Mindwipe
entries: {@b Manifestation Time:} 1 action
{@b Range:} 60 feet

modes.name: 6th-Order
entries: You attempt to wipe the mind of a creature you can see within range, which must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the target takes {@damage 3d10} psychic damage. On a failure, the target's proficiency bonus is +0 (reducing the bonus they add to ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws they make with proficiency), and they can't cast spells, manifest powers, understand language, or communicate in any intelligible way. All these effects last for the duration.

psionic.name: Paragon
entries: {@b Manifestation Time:} 1 action
{@b Range:} Touch
{@b Duration:} 8 hours

modes.name: 6th-Order
entries: One willing creature you touch becomes a paragon of physical and mental perfection. For the duration, each of the target's ability scores is 20, unless a score is already higher.

psionic.name: Reflection
entries: {@b Manifestation Time:} 1 action
{@b Range:} 60 feet

modes.name: 6th-Order
entries: You choose one creature that you can see within range that has a challenge rating of 10 or lower (or that is 10th level or lower, for creatures that don't have a challenge rating), then psionically create a perfect copy of that creature. (You can copy yourself if you have access to this power at an appropriate level.)

The copy appears within an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range, and acts on your initiative count immediately after you take your turn. The copy has the same statistics as the original creature, except that they have mundane copies of the creature's equipment, and have no lair actions, legendary actions, or villain actions.

The copy reflects the original creature's current state, both physically (clean, disheveled, healthy, wounded, and so forth) and in terms of resources (current hit points, spell slots available, current strain, and so forth). The copy is loyal to you and understands the commands you give them through a mental link you share, within the bounds of their normal intellect. They disappear when they are reduced to 0 hit points.

psionic.name: Rejuvenate
entries: {@b Manifestation Time:} 1 action
{@b Range:} Touch
{@b Duration:} Instantaneous
You touch one creature and reshape the flow of time through their body, restoring them to an earlier state. The target gains one of the following benefits:

modes.name: Closed Wounds
entries: The target regains 50 hit points.

modes.name: Fresh Start
entries: Any of the following conditions affecting the target end: {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition dazed|FleeMortals}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition petrified}, {@condition poisoned}, or {@condition stunned}.

modes.name: Regain Spell
entries: Roll {@dice 1d4 + 1}. The target regains one expended spell slot, the level of which equals the result or lower (the target's choice).

psionic.name: Souls Intertwined
entries: {@b Manifestation Time:} 1 action
{@b Range:} 60 feet

modes.name: 6th-Order
entries: You attempt to swap the minds of two creatures you can see within range, each of which must make a Charisma saving throw. If only one creature fails the saving throw, that creature takes {@damage 6d10} psychic damage.

If both saving throws fail, the creatures' minds are swapped for the duration, so that each creature's memories, knowledge, instincts, and sense of self are contained in a new body. While their minds are swapped, each creature uses the other's Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, which could impact other statistics such as a creature's spell save or power save DCs. For the purpose of supernatural effects that identify, locate, or make contact with a creature, the body that holds a creature's mind is considered to be that creature while this power is in effect.
If one of the affected creatures dies while the other still lives, the dying creature can make a choice as their soul leaves their host body:

items: The soul can move on to the afterlife, leaving the mind of the other creature targeted by this power permanently in a new body. Only a {@spell wish} spell or similar magic can allow a creature permanently sealed inside another's body to return to their original form.

The soul can attempt to force their way back into their original body. Both creatures make a contested Charisma check, rerolling ties. If the dying soul wins the contest, they reclaim their old body and force the other creature's soul into the afterlife.

psionic.name: Steel
entries: {@b Manifestation Time:} 1 action
{@b Range:} Self

modes.name: 6th-Order
entries: Your skin turns into a hard, shiny metal, granting you the following benefits for the duration:

items: You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
Any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.

You can take the Attack action to make up to three unarmed strikes. Each strike is a psionic melee weapon attack that uses your manifestation ability for attack rolls instead of Strength or Dexterity. On a hit, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 2d10} + your manifestation ability modifier instead of the normal bludgeoning damage for an unarmed strike.
At the start of your turn, if you have at least 1 hit point, you regain 10 hit points.

race.name: Gemstone Dragonborn
entries: As a gemstone dragonborn, you have the following racial traits.

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a Humanoid.

entries.name: Size
entries: You are Medium. On average, gemstone dragonborn are as tall as humans, meaning many other dragonborn tower over them.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: When determining your character's ability scores, increase one score by 2 and increase a different score by 1, or increase three different scores by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Gemstone dragonborn mature quickly, with their reptilian heritage producing children who can walk and talk only a few months after birth. They reach adulthood at the age of 7 and live to be around 115, longer than their chromatic and metallic cousins.

entries.name: Crystal Armor
entries: You have vibrant, glowing crystals embedded in your scaled skin. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Draconic Ancestry
entries: You have a gemstone dragon ancestor, granting you a special psionic trait:

items.name: Amethyst: Feedback
entries: When a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see damages you, you can use your reaction to force the creature to make an Intelligence saving throw. The save DC equals 8 + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (your choice) + your proficiency bonus. The creature takes {@damage 3d6} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

items.name: Emerald: Interference
entries: When a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see takes damage from a spell or power, you can use your reaction to disrupt the effect. Roll a {@dice d12} and add your level, then reduce the damage the creature takes by the total. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

items.name: Ruby: Amplification
entries: As an action, you target a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The target rolls a {@dice d4}, and until the end of your next turn, their power or spell save DC (your choice) is increased by the number rolled. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

items.name: Sapphire: Awe
entries: As a reaction when a creature you can see within 30 feet of you targets you with an attack, you force the creature to make a Charisma saving throw. The save DC equals 8 + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (your choice) + your proficiency bonus. On a failed save, the attack misses. On a success, you take half as much damage from the attack. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

items.name: Topaz: Uplift
entries: As an action, you target a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. For 1 minute, whenever the target makes an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma check or saving throw, they can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the {@dice d20} roll. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Natural Psionics
entries: You learn one 1st-order psionic power of your choice from the following list: {@psionic apparition|TalPsi}, {@psionic concussive slam|TalPsi}, {@psionic flame's master|TalPsi}, {@psionic illuminator|TalPsi}, {@psionic invisible force|TalPsi}, {@psionic psionic bolt|TalPsi}, {@psionic psychic stab|TalPsi}, {@psionic rewrite|TalPsi}, or {@psionic time thief|TalPsi}. Your manifestation ability for this power is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma, which you choose when you select this ancestry.

entries.name: Telepathy
entries: You can communicate telepathically with any creature you can see within 30 feet of you. You don't need to share a language with the creature for them to understand these messages, but they must be able to understand at least one language.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can read, speak, and write Common and one other language of your choice.

items.name: {{gemstone}}: {{power}}
entries: {{entriesText}}

_variables.entriesText: When a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see damages you, you can use your reaction to force the creature to make an Intelligence saving throw. The save DC equals 8 + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (your choice) + your proficiency bonus. The creature takes {@damage 3d6} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

When a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see takes damage from a spell or power, you can use your reaction to disrupt the effect. Roll a {@dice d12} and add your level, then reduce the damage the creature takes by the total. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

As an action, you target a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The target rolls a {@dice d4}, and until the end of your next turn, their power or spell save DC (your choice) is increased by the number rolled. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

As a reaction when a creature you can see within 30 feet of you targets you with an attack, you force the creature to make a Charisma saving throw. The save DC equals 8 + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (your choice) + your proficiency bonus. On a failed save, the attack misses. On a success, you take half as much damage from the attack. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

As an action, you target a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. For 1 minute, whenever the target makes an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma check or saving throw, they can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the {@dice d20} roll. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

raceFluff.name: Gemstone Dragonborn
entries: Much rarer than their metallic or chromatic cousins, gemstone dragonborn are the offspring of the gemstone dragons and the result of powerful psionic rituals. Their gemstone ancestry is obvious at first glance, for every gemstone dragonborn bears multifaceted crystals embedded in their scales, and their eyes are solid gemstones. In times of extreme emotion—with the specific emotion varying from individual to individual—those gemstones flare with light.

Because gemstone dragons are so rare as to be considered mythical, it's not unusual for their dragonborn descendants to pursue great quests in search of a gemstone dragon—perhaps even their own ultimate progenitor. Successfully finding one is a huge achievement, granting both a sense of where the dragonborn came from, and helping prove to the wider world that the jeweled dragons are actually real.

feat.name: Augmented Force

prerequisite.other: The ability to manifest at least one power

entries: When you gain this feat, choose one of the following damage types: fire, force, or psychic. Powers you manifest ignore resistance to damage of the chosen type, and they treat immunity to damage of this type as resistance instead.
Additionally, when you roll damage for a power you manifest that deals damage of the chosen type, you can treat any 1 on a damage die as a 2.
You can select this feat multiple times. Each time you do so, you must choose a different damage type.

feat.name: Battlemind

prerequisite.other: The ability to manifest at least one power

entries: Your experience in manifesting powers during combat grants you the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain {@status concentration} on your active powers when you take damage.

When a hostile creature's movement provokes an opportunity attack from you, you can use your reaction to {@action Manifest a Power|TalPsi|manifest a power} that targets the creature, rather than making an opportunity attack. The power must have a manifestation time of 1 action and must target only that creature.
Whenever you gain strain, that stress triggers a protective buffer that grants you {@dice 1d4} temporary hit points.

feat.name: Better under Pressure

prerequisite.other: The ability to manifest at least one power and gain strain

entries: You are able to turn the strain of body, mind, and soul into bursts of focused energy, tracked as pressure points. Whenever you gain strain, you also gain 1 pressure point for each strain you gain this way. Thereafter, whenever you make an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can spend up to 3 pressure points and add 1 to the roll for each point spent. You can wait until after you roll the {@dice d20} before deciding to spend pressure points. You lose all your pressure points when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Psionic Initiate
entries: You can tap into the power of your mind to manifest powers, granting you the following benefits:

items: You learn two {@filter 1st-order powers|psionics|order=1st-order} of your choice.

You learn one {@filter 2nd-order power|psionics|order=2nd-order} of your choice and can manifest it at its lowest order without needing to make a manifestation test. Once you manifest this power using this feat, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries: Your manifestation ability for these powers is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (your choice).

feat.name: Psionic Trick
entries: You mind can create psionic effects, granting you the following benefits:

items: You can speak telepathically to any creature you can see within 60 feet of you that understands a language. Your communication doesn't give the creature the ability to respond to you telepathically.
You learn the {@psionic psionic shift|TalPsi} power. Your manifestation ability for this power is Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma (your choice).

As a bonus action, you can choose a Small or smaller mundane object that you can see within 30 feet of you that isn't being worn or carried by another creature, then light that object on fire. The object takes {@damage 1d4} fire damage at the end of each of your turns until it is destroyed, or until a creature uses an action or bonus action to put out the flames.

item.name: Armor of Psionic Absorption
entries: While wearing this armor, you have a +1 bonus to AC. In addition, whenever you gain strain, the energy leeched from your body, mind, or soul is stored in the armor. For every 1 strain you gain, the armor gains 1 charge.

As an action, you can expend any number of charges from the armor to unleash a beam of force at a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw against your power save DC, taking {@damage 1d6} force damage for each expended charge on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The armor can hold a maximum of 10 charges, and loses all unused charges each day at dawn.

item.name: Bedroll of Vim
entries: If you spend at least 6 hours of a long rest wrapped in this silk bedroll, you regain all your spent Hit Dice when you finish the rest. Only one creature can benefit from the bedroll at a time.

item.name: Crystal of Rejuvenation
entries: This crystal contains psionic energy that causes you to lose 1 strain when you break it.

item.name: Crystal of Greater Rejuvenation
entries: This crystal contains psionic energy that causes you to lose {@dice 1d4 + 1} strain when you break it.

item.name: Crystal of Superior Rejuvenation
entries: This crystal contains psionic energy that causes you to lose {@dice 2d4 + 2} strain when you break it.

item.name: Crystal of Supreme Rejuvenation
entries: This crystal contains psionic energy that causes you to lose {@dice 4d4 + 4} strain when you break it.

item.name: Headband of Power Storing
entries: This silver headband stores powers that are manifested into it, holding them until the attuned wearer uses them. The headband can store powers whose combined order totals 5 or fewer. When found, it contains powers determined by the GM, whose combined order totals {@dice 1d6 - 1}.

Any creature can {@action Manifest a Power|TalPsi|manifest a power} of {@filter 1st order through 5th order|psionics|order=1st-order;2nd-order;3rd-order;4th-order;5th-order} into the headband by touching the headband as the power is manifested. That power has no effect, other than to be stored in the headband. If the headband can't hold the power, the power is expended without effect.

While wearing this headband, you can manifest any power stored in it. The power uses the baseline order, power save DC, power attack modifier, and manifestation ability of the original manifester, but is otherwise treated as if you manifested the power.
A power manifested from the headband is no longer stored in it, freeing up space.

item.name: Hero's Cape
entries: While you wear this flowing, colorful cape, you have a flying speed of 90 feet and can hover.

Additionally, you can use an action to send forth a 15-foot cone of psionic force. Each creature in the area must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 6d6} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

item.name: Orb of Psionic Might +1
entries: While holding this grapefruit-sized crystal orb, you gain a +1 bonus to power attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your talent powers.

item.name: Orb of Psionic Might +2
entries: While holding this grapefruit-sized crystal orb, you gain a +2 bonus to power attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your talent powers.

item.name: Orb of Psionic Might +3
entries: While holding this grapefruit-sized crystal orb, you gain a +3 bonus to power attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your talent powers.

item.name: Power Crystal
entries: A {@i power crystal} holds a single psionic power. When you break this crystal as an action, you immediately manifest the power within it, regardless of the power's normal manifestation time. The order of the power in the crystal determines its power save DC and attack modifier, as well as the crystal's rarity, as shown on the Power Crystal table.

item.name: Staff of Chronopathy
entries: This staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can expend 1 or more of its charges to manifest one of the following powers from it, using an action or the power's indicated manifesting time, and using your talent power save DC: {@psionic forget|TalPsi} (2 charges), {@psionic intuition|TalPsi} (1 charge), {@psionic ravages of time|TalPsi} (2 charges), or {@psionic stasis field|TalPsi} (4 charges; 10 minutes).
Additionally, if you fail a saving throw while holding the staff, you can use your reaction to expend 1 charge and reroll the save, using either roll.
The staff regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Staff of Metamorphosis
entries: This staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to manifest one of the following powers from it, using your talent power save DC: {@psionic beam gaze|TalPsi} (2 charges), {@psionic cure ailment|TalPsi} (2 charges), {@psionic shadow form|TalPsi} (4 charges), or {@psionic sixth sense|TalPsi} (1 charge).
Additionally, while holding the staff, you can use an action to touch a creature with it and expend any number of charges. The creature regains {@dice 1d8} hit points per expended charge.
The staff regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Staff of Pyrokinesis
entries: This staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to manifest one of the following powers from it, using your talent power save DC: {@psionic fire form|TalPsi} (4 charges), {@psionic imbue flame|TalPsi} (2 charges), {@psionic melt|TalPsi} (4 charges), or {@psionic scorch|TalPsi} (1 charge).
Additionally, when you make a melee attack with the staff, you can use your Intelligence modifier instead of your Strength modifier for attack and damage rolls.
When you hit with a melee attack using the staff, you can expend any number of charges, dealing an extra {@damage 1d8} fire damage to the target per expended charge.
The staff regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Staff of Resopathy
entries: This staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to manifest one of the following powers from it, using your talent power save DC: {@psionic extinguish|TalPsi} (2 charges), {@psionic guise|TalPsi} (2 charges), {@psionic reminisce|TalPsi} (4 charges), or {@psionic weight|TalPsi} (1 charge).
Additionally, while holding the staff, you can expend 1 charge as a bonus action to give yourself {@sense truesight} out to a range of 30 feet for 1 minute.
The staff regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Staff of Telekinesis
entries: This staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can expend 1 or more of its charges to manifest one of the following powers from it, using your talent power save DC: {@psionic fulcrum|TalPsi} (4 charges), {@psionic gravitational collapse|TalPsi} (4 charges), {@psionic repel|TalPsi} (1 charge), or {@psionic telekinetic burst|TalPsi} (2 charges).

Additionally, while holding the staff, you can expend 1 charge to give yourself a flying speed of 60 feet until the end of your next turn (no action required). If you already have a flying speed, that speed increases by 60 feet until the end of your next turn.
The staff regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Staff of Telepathy
entries: This staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can expend 1 or more of its charges to manifest one of the following powers from it, using your talent power save DC: {@psionic believe|TalPsi} (1 charge), {@psionic dagger of the mind|TalPsi} (2 charges), {@psionic distant voice|TalPsi} (2 charges), or {@psionic harlequin|TalPsi} (4 charges).

Additionally, while holding the staff, you can use an action to expend 1 charge and choose a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. For 1 minute, you learn the surface thoughts of that creature—what is most on their mind in that moment. If the creature has an Intelligence of 3 or lower or doesn't speak any language, you learn nothing from it.

While you are reading a creature's surface thoughts with the staff, you can expend 1 charge as a bonus action to dig deeper into the target's mind, forcing them to make an Intelligence saving throw against your talent power save DC. On a success, your ability to read the creature's surface thoughts ends. On a failure, you gain insight into the target's reasoning (if any), their emotional state, and one thing that looms large in their mind (a problem they are worried over, a person they love or hate, and so forth).
Whether the saving throw succeeds or fails, the target doesn't know that you attempted to dig into their mind.
The staff regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn.

itemGroup.name: Crystal of Rejuvenation (*)
entries: {@note * This item group has the same name and source as the item {@item Crystal of Rejuvenation|TalPsi}}
This crystal contains psionic energy that causes you to lose strain when you break it. The amount of strain you lose depends on the crystal's rarity, as shown in the Crystals of Rejuvenation table.

entries.name: Psionic Crystal
entries: Psionic items use the same categories as magic items, but add one additional category—psionic crystal, a consumable psionic item akin to potions or spell scrolls. A creature can use an action to break one of these applesized crystals, unleashing the psionic power stored within.

monster.name: Cthrion Uroniziir

spellcasting.name: Powers
headerEntries: In addition to the other powers in this stat block, Cthrion Uroniziir can manifest the following powers, using Intelligence as her manifestation ability (power save {@dc 26}):

trait.name: Psionic Weapons
entries: Cthrion Uroniziir's weapon attacks are psionic.

trait.name: Sacrificial Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Cthrion Uroniziir fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead. When she uses this trait, her Time Aura doesn't function until the start of her next turn.

trait.name: Supernatural Resistance
entries: Cthrion Uroniziir has advantage on saving throws against powers, spells, and other psionic and magical effects.

trait.name: Time Aura
entries: A psionic aura surrounds Cthrion Uroniziir in a 60-foot-radius sphere. When a creature starts their turn within the aura, Cthrion Uroniziir can force that creature to succeed on a {@dc 26} Constitution saving throw or suffer the following effects until the start of their next turn: the creature's speed is halved, and they can take an action or a bonus action but not both.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Cthrion Uroniziir uses Inhale, then makes one Bite attack, two Claw attacks, and one Tail attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +18 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 4d10 + 9}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} +18 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d6 + 9}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} +18 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d8 + 9}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Inhale
entries: Cthrion Uroniziir creates an area of vacuum in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 26} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 20 feet toward Cthrion Uroniziir and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Cosmic Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: Cthrion Uroniziir exhales the chaotic temporal energy of another world in a 90-foot cone.

Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 26} Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) bludgeoning damage and 45 ({@damage 10d8}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Jaunt (6th-Order Power)
entries: Cthrion Uroniziir or one willing creature she touches teleports to an unoccupied space she can see within 75 feet of her.

reaction.name: Capture Energy (3rd-Order Power)
entries: When Cthrion Uroniziir takes acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, or thunder damage, she takes only half the damage. She can then make a ranged power attack with a +18 bonus against a creature or object within 30 feet of her. If the attack hits, the target takes the remainder of the triggering damage.

legendaryHeader: Cthrion Uroniziir has three villain actions. She can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy creature's turn. She can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.

legendary.name: Action 1: Monolith
entries: Cthrion Uroniziir conjures a 5-foot-wide, 20-foot-tall onyx monolith in an unoccupied space she can see within 120 feet of her. The monolith has AC 20; 200 hit points; immunity to fire and poison damage; and immunity to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from mundane attacks. On initiative count 10 while Cthrion Uroniziir can see the monolith, each creature of her choice within 30 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) lightning damage. If Cthrion Uroniziir is within 30 feet of the monolith on initiative count 10, she regains 21 ({@dice 6d6}) hit points.

legendary.name: Action 2: Faster than Time
entries: Cthrion Uroniziir moves up to her speed without provoking opportunity attacks. Whenever she comes within 10 feet of a creature for the first time during this movement, she can make one Claw Attack with advantage against that creature.

legendary.name: Action 3: Ultimate Reflection
entries: Cthrion Uroniziir creates a duplicate of herself that appears in an unoccupied space within 120 feet of her. The duplicate acts on her initiative immediately after she takes her turn. This duplicate has the same statistics as Cthrion Uroniziir, except that they have 200 hit points and lack her Time Aura trait, her Cosmic Breath and Inhale actions, and her villain actions. The duplicate disappears when it or Cthrion Uroniziir is reduced to 0 hit points.

monster.name: Graxituron

spellcasting.name: Powers
headerEntries: In addition to the other powers in this stat block, Graxituron can manifest the following powers, using Intelligence as his manifestation ability (power save {@dc 24}):

trait.name: Awe Aura
entries: A psionic aura surrounds Graxituron in a 30-footradius sphere. Whenever a hostile creature starts their turn in the aura, they must succeed on a {@dc 24} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of Graxituron until the start of their next turn. While {@condition frightened} in this way, the target can't undertake any action intended to harm Graxituron. On a successful save, a creature is immune to Graxituron's Awe Aura, but not his Exploding Aura, for 24 hours.

trait.name: Psionic Weapons
entries: Graxituron's weapon attacks are psionic.

trait.name: Sacrificial Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Graxituron fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead. When Graxituron uses this trait, his Awe Aura doesn't function until the start of his next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Graxituron uses Growing Aura. He then makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks, or he uses Telekinetic Burst or Mass Choke, if available.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +16 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d10 + 9}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d6 + 9}) slashing damage.

action.name: Growing Aura
entries: If the radius of Graxituron's Awe Aura is less than 60 feet, it increases 15 feet to a maximum of 60 feet.

action.name: Exploding Aura
entries: If the radius of Graxituron's Awe Aura is 60 feet, the aura explodes in a burst of temporal energy. Each creature of Graxituron's choice within 60 feet of him must make a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw, taking 91 ({@damage 26d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The radius of Graxituron's Awe Aura then shrinks to 30 feet.

action.name: Telekinetic Burst (3/Day; 6th-Order Power)
entries: Graxituron unleashes a 20-foot-radius sphere of force centered on a point he can see within 90 feet of him. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 38 ({@damage 11d6}) force damage and is pushed 10 feet away from the center of the area. On a success, the target takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

action.name: Mass Choke (1/Day; 6th-Order Power; Concentration)
entries: Each creature of Graxituron's choice within 30 feet of him must succeed on a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition restrained} for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). A creature {@condition restrained} in this way takes 22 ({@damage 5d8}) force damage at the start of each of their turns.

legendaryHeader: Graxituron has three villain actions. He can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy creature's turn.
He can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.

legendary.name: Action 1: Return to Weakness
entries: Graxituron unleashes a wave of temporal distortion, attempting to return enemies to a time when they were in a vulnerable state. Each hostile creature within 60 feet of him must succeed on a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw or wither for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). At the start of each of their turns, an affected creature has their hit point maximum reduced by 11 ({@dice 2d10}).

If a creature's hit point maximum is reduced to 0 this way, they die and crumble to dust. The cure ailment power, the {@spell lesser restoration} spell, or a similar supernatural effect ends the withering effect if still ongoing, and restores an affected creature's hit point maximum to normal.

legendary.name: Action 2: Midnight Hour
entries: Psionic darkness pours from Graxituron's body in a 30-foot-radius aura that lasts until the end of his next turn. The darkness spreads around corners.

A creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness, and light can't illuminate it. When a creature other than Graxituron ends their turn in the darkness, Graxituron can move that creature up to 15 feet horizontally.

legendary.name: Action 3: A Different You
entries: Graxituron chooses another creature he can see within 120 feet of him and calls forth a duplicate version of that creature from another timeline to serve him. The duplicate appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of Graxituron, and uses the same statistics as the original creature as if that creature had just finished a long rest. The duplicate immediately takes one turn, acting as directed by Graxituron. At the end of the duplicate's turn, it dies in a psionic explosion, and the original creature must make a {@dc 24} Wisdom saving throw, taking 55 ({@damage 10d10}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Nelisardrim

spellcasting.name: Powers
headerEntries: In addition to the other powers in this stat block, Nelisardrim can manifest the following powers, using Intelligence as their manifestation ability:

trait.name: Magic Dabbler
entries: Nelisardrim can use and attune to any magic item, no matter its prerequisites. If the item makes use of its wielder's spell save DC, Nelisardrim uses their power save DC (14) instead.

trait.name: Psionic Weapons
entries: Nelisardrim's weapon attacks are psionic.

trait.name: Sacrificial Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Nelisardrim fails a saving throw, they can choose to succeed instead. When Nelisardrim uses this trait, their Uplift Aura doesn't function until the start of their next turn.

trait.name: Uplift Aura
entries: A psionic aura surrounds Nelisardrim in a 30-foot-radius sphere. Each creature of Nelisardrim's choice in the aura has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma checks and saving throws.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Nelisardrim uses Widening Aura. They then make one Bite attack and two Claw attacks, or they use Melt if available.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Widening Aura
entries: If the radius of Nelisardrim's Uplift Aura is less than 60 feet, it increases 15 feet to a maximum of 60 feet.

If the aura's radius reaches 60 feet, the aura explodes in a burst of empowering energy. Each creature of Nelisardrim's choice within 60 feet of them has advantage on attack rolls and deals an extra {@damage 1d6} force damage with attacks, with both benefits lasting until the end of Nelisardrim's next turn. The radius of Nelisardrim's Uplift Aura then shrinks to 30 feet.

action.name: Melt (1/Day; 4th-Order Power)
entries: Nelisardrim chooses a manufactured mundane metal object no larger than Medium that they can see within 60 feet of them. If the object isn't being carried or worn by a creature, it melts into useless slag. If the object is being carried or worn by a creature, that creature must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 27 ({@damage 5d10}) fire damage and the object melts into useless slag. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and the object doesn't melt.

bonus.name: Psionic Shift (1st-Order Power)
entries: Nelisardrim chooses one creature other than themself that they can see within 15 feet of them, and that isn't {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained}. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be moved 5 feet in a direction of Nelisardrim's choice. The target can choose to fail this saving throw.

reaction.name: Again (3/Day; 2nd-Order Power)
entries: When Nelisardrim or a creature they can see within 30 feet of them misses with an attack roll, Nelisardrim momentarily rewinds time. The attacker can reroll the attack and must use the new roll.

legendaryHeader: Nelisardrim has three villain actions. They can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy creature's turn.
They can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.

legendary.name: Action 1: Experimental Concoction
entries: Nelisardrim conjures and hurls a vial at a point they can see within 60 feet of them. Each creature within 15 feet of that point must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or become covered in caustic glue. While covered in the glue, a creature takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) acid damage at the start of each of their turns. A creature can use an action to remove the glue from themself or another creature they can reach.

legendary.name: Action 2: Telekinetic Pulse
entries: Nelisardrim releases a wave of telekinetic energy, forcing each creature within 15 feet of them to make a {@dc 14} Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) force damage and falls {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall {@condition prone}. Nelisardrim then moves up to their speed.

legendary.name: Action 3: Antimagic Fireball
entries: Nelisardrim creates a psionic explosion in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point they can see within 120 feet of them. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Any spell of 3rd level or lower affecting a creature, object, or magical effect in the area then ends.

monster.name: Profundrus

spellcasting.name: Powers
headerEntries: In addition to the other powers in this stat block, Profundrus can manifest the following powers, using Intelligence as his manifestation ability:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Profundrus can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Interference Aura
entries: A psionic aura surrounds Profundrus in a 30-foot-radius sphere. Whenever a hostile creature {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell or on one or more powers starts their turn in the aura, they take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.

trait.name: Psionic Weapons
entries: Profundrus's weapon attacks are psionic.

trait.name: Sacrificial Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Profundrus fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead. When he uses this trait, his Interference Aura doesn't function until the start of his next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Profundrus uses Growing Aura. He then makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks, or he uses Dagger of the Mind or Heat Transfer, if available.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +14 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Growing Aura
entries: If the radius of Profundrus's Interference Aura is less than 60 feet, it increases 15 feet to a maximum of 60 feet.

action.name: Exploding Aura
entries: If the radius of Profundrus's Interference Aura is 60 feet, the aura explodes in a burst of sickening energy. Each creature of Profundrus's choice within 60 feet of him must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw, taking 66 ({@damage 12d10}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This damage ignores resistance or immunity to poison damage. The radius of Profundrus's Interference Aura then shrinks to 30 feet.

action.name: Dagger of the Mind (3/Day; 4th-Order Power)
entries: Profundrus chooses one creature he can see within 60 feet of him, which must make a {@dc 22} Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) psychic damage and can take only the Dash, Disengage, or Dodge actions on their next turn. On a success, the target takes half as much damage and can take their turn normally.

action.name: Heat Transfer (1/Day; 6th-Order Power; Concentration)
entries: Profundrus chooses a creature that isn't a Construct or Undead that he can see within 120 feet of him. For 1 minute, the target must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw at the start of each of their turns, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Whenever the target takes cold damage from this power, Profundrus can choose another creature that isn't a Construct or Undead who he can see within 120 feet of him. That creature regains a number of hit points equal to half the cold damage dealt to the target.

bonus.name: Amplify (4th-Order Power)
entries: Profundrus chooses one creature he can see within 30 feet of him. The next time the target hits a creature with a weapon attack within the next minute, that attack deals an extra 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage.

legendaryHeader: Profundrus has three villain actions. He can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy creature's turn. He can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.

legendary.name: Action 1: Astral Riptide
entries: Profundrus calls forth waters from the Astral Sea. Each hostile creature within 60 feet of him must succeed on a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 30 feet toward him or pushed up to 30 feet away from him (Profundrus's choice). Each creature then falls {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Action 2: Open the Rift
entries: Profundrus disappears in a burst of brilliant psionic energy, forcing each creature within 30 feet of him to succeed on a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn. Profundrus then reappears in an unoccupied space within 120 feet of his original location.

legendary.name: Action 3: Tear Reality
entries: Profundrus opens a rift in space and time, creating a 20-foot-radius sphere of overwhelming emotional energy centered on a point he can see within 120 feet of him. The rift lasts for 1 minute. A creature that enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts their turn there must make a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw, taking 44 ({@damage 8d10}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Tersasalla

spellcasting.name: Powers
headerEntries: In addition to the other powers in this stat block, Tersasalla can manifest the following powers, using Intelligence as their manifestation ability:

trait.name: Amplification Aura
entries: A psionic aura surrounds Tersasalla in a 30-foot-radius sphere. Each allied creature of Tersasalla's choice that can cast spells or manifest powers have a +3 bonus to their power save DC and spell save DC while in the aura.
Tersasalla isn't affected by the aura.

trait.name: Psionic Weapons
entries: Tersasalla's weapon attacks are psionic.

trait.name: Sacrificial Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Tersasalla fails a saving throw, they can choose to succeed instead. When Tersasalla uses this trait, their Amplification Aura doesn't function until the start of their next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Tersasalla uses Growing Aura. They then make one Bite attack and two Claw attacks, or they use Fracture if available.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Growing Aura
entries: If the radius of Tersasalla's Amplification Aura is less than 60 feet, it increases 15 feet to a maximum of 60 feet.

action.name: Exploding Aura
entries: If the radius of Tersasalla's Amplification Aura is 60 feet, the aura explodes in a burst of psychic energy.

Each creature of Tersasalla's choice within 60 feet of them must make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw, taking 66 ({@damage 12d10}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The radius of Tersasalla's Amplification Aura then shrinks to 30 feet.

action.name: Fracture (2/Day; 5th-Order Power)
entries: Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within 90 feet of Tersasalla must make a {@dc 20} Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 27 ({@damage 6d8}) psychic damage and is fractured for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't fractured.
While fractured, a creature's speed is halved; they have disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws; and attack rolls against them have advantage.

bonus.name: Glimpse (1st-Order Power; Concentration)
entries: Tersasalla picks one willing creature they can see within 5 feet of them.
The next attack roll made against the target before the end of Tersasalla's next turn has disadvantage.

reaction.name: Share Pain (3/Day; 3rd-Order Power)
entries: When Tersasalla is damaged by a creature they can see within 60 feet of them, they force the creature to make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw.
The target takes 13 ({@damage 2d12}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendaryHeader: Tersasalla has three villain actions. They can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy creature's turn.
They can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.

legendary.name: Action 1: Weight of Reality
entries: Tersasalla drops an {@condition invisible} weight on each hostile creature they can see within 60 feet of them. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 3d10}) force damage and fall {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Action 2: Hungry for Magic
entries: Tersasalla teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space they can see that is within 10 feet of a creature that can cast spells. They then make two Bite attacks with advantage against the creature.

legendary.name: Action 3: Shield of Vengeance
entries: Tersasalla surrounds themself in a shimmering psionic shield that lasts until the end of their next turn. Whenever a creature deals damage to Tersasalla with an unarmed strike, a weapon attack, or a spell while the shield is active, that creature takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) psychic damage.

monster.name: Viomencia

spellcasting.name: Powers
headerEntries: In addition to the other powers in this stat block, Viomencia can manifest the following powers, using Intelligence as her manifestation ability (power save {@dc 19}):

trait.name: Feedback Aura (1/Turn)
entries: A psionic aura surrounds Viomencia in a 30-foot-radius sphere. When Viomencia takes damage, the aura crackles and each hostile creature in the aura takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage.

trait.name: Psionic Weapons
entries: Viomencia's weapon attacks are psionic.

trait.name: Sacrificial Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Viomencia fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead. When she uses this trait, her Feedback Aura doesn't function until the start of her next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Viomencia uses Growing Aura. She then makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks, or she uses Beam Gaze if available.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Growing Aura
entries: If the radius of Viomencia's Feedback Aura is less than 60 feet, it increases 15 feet to a maximum of 60 feet.

action.name: Exploding Aura
entries: If the radius of Viomencia's Feedback Aura is 60 feet, the aura explodes in a burst of harsh light. Each hostile creature within 60 feet of Viomencia must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking 55 ({@damage 10d10}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The radius of Viomencia's Feedback Aura then shrinks to 30 feet.

action.name: Beam Gaze (3/Day; 4th-Order Power)
entries: Viomencia unleashes a sickening beam of force at a creature she can see within 120 feet of her. The target must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 5d10}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, the target also suffers Viomencia's choice of one of the following effects for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn):

items: The target's speed is halved, and they can't take reactions.
Attack rolls against the target are made with advantage.

bonus.name: Jaunt (3/Day; 3rd-Order Power)
entries: Viomencia or one willing creature she touches teleports to an unoccupied space Viomencia can see within 30 feet of her.

reaction.name: Fortify (2nd-Order Power)
entries: When Viomencia or a creature she can see within 30 feet of her takes acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, or thunder damage, that creature has resistance to the triggering damage type (including against the triggering damage) until the end of Viomencia's next turn.

legendaryHeader: Viomencia has three villain actions. She can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy creature's turn.
She can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.

legendary.name: Action 1: I've Seen This
entries: Viomencia plunders the mind of each hostile creature within 60 feet of her to learn their tactics. Each target has disadvantage on the next attack roll they make against Viomencia, and she has advantage on saving throws made to resist powers, spells, and effects created by each target before the end of that target's next turn.

legendary.name: Action 2: Amethyst Charm
entries: Viomencia unleashes a pulse of telepathic power. Each hostile creature within 60 feet of her must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by her. Each target {@condition charmed} in this way must immediately move up to their speed in a direction of Viomencia's choice, then make a weapon attack or cast a damage-dealing cantrip at a target of her choice. Viomencia can then move up to her speed, and the {@condition charmed} condition on each target ends.

legendary.name: Action 3: Utter Devastation
entries: Viomencia enters the mind of each hostile creature she can see within 60 feet of her and offers them a bargain: pain or risk? Each target must choose between losing half their remaining hit points or having disadvantage on saving throws against Viomencia's powers and her Exploding Aura for 10 minutes.

action.name: Intuition (3/Day; 2nd-Order Power; Concentration)
entries: The chronopath gifts precognitive insight to up to three willing creatures within 30 feet of them that they can see. For 1 minute, each time a target takes damage, the damage is reduced by {@dice 1d4} (minimum 0 damage).

bonus.name: Time Thief (1st-Order Power)
entries: The chronopath chooses a creature within 30 feet of them, which must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 3d4}) necrotic damage. The chronopath gains temporary hit points equal to the damage taken.

action.name: Witness Demise (3/Day; 5th-Order Power)
entries: The chronopath chooses up to three creatures they can see within 30 feet of them, each of which must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) psychic damage and is {@condition frightened} of the chronopath for 1 minute. On a success, a target takes half as much damage and is not {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Ally of Time (1/Day; 6th-Order Power; Concentration)
entries: The chronopath alters time in a 40-foot cube within 120 feet of them. Whenever a creature starts their turn in the cube, the chronopath picks one of the following effects:

items.name: Accelerate
entries: Until the start of the target's next turn, their speed is doubled, they have a +2 bonus to AC, and they have advantage on Dexterity saving throws. The target gains an additional action that can be used only to take the Attack action (one weapon attack only), the Cast a Spell action (cantrip only), the {@action Manifest a Power|TalPsi} action (1st-Order power only), or the Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object actions.

items.name: Decelerate
entries: The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or suffer the following effects until the start of their next turn: their speed is halved, they have a -2 penalty to AC, they have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and they can't use reactions. Additionally, the creature can take an action or a bonus action on their current turn, but not both, and can't make more than one attack regardless of features or magic items.

bonus.name: Time Thief (1st-Order Power)
entries: The chronopath chooses a creature within 30 feet of them, which must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 4d4}) necrotic damage. The chronopath gains temporary hit points equal to the damage taken.

reaction.name: Again (3/Day; 2nd-Order Power)
entries: When the chronopath or a creature they can see within 30 feet of them misses with an attack roll, the chronopath momentarily rewinds time. The attacker can reroll the attack and must use the new roll.

spellcasting.name: Powers

reaction.name: Shock Absorption (3/Day)
entries: When the maverick takes damage, they halve the damage they take.

action.name: Melt (1/Day; 5th-Order Power)
entries: The maverick chooses a manufactured mundane metal object no larger than Medium that they can see within 60 feet of them. If the object isn't being carried or worn by a creature, it melts into useless slag. If the object is being carried or worn by a creature, that creature must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 38 ({@damage 7d10}) fire damage and the object melts into useless slag. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and the object doesn't melt.

reaction.name: Shock Absorption (3/Day)
entries: When the maverick takes damage, they halve the damage they take.

entries: When the maverick deals damage with a power, they can deal maximum damage instead of rolling damage dice.

trait.name: Overwhelming Power (3/Day)
entries: When a creature succeeds on a saving throw against a power the maverick manifests, the maverick can force the creature to reroll the saving throw with a -4 penalty. The creature must use the new roll.

action.name: Psychic Stab (1st-Order Power)
entries: One creature the maverick can see within 120 feet of them must succeed on a {@dc 17} Intelligence saving throw or take 27 ({@damage 4d10 + 5}) psychic damage.

action.name: Flay (3/Day; 5th-Order Power)
entries: The maverick shoots forth a 15-foot cone of pure psionic energy. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 17} Intelligence saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items: The target's speed is halved, and they can't take reactions.

entries: The metamorph touches one creature (which can be themself), causing that creature to regain 11 ({@dice 2d10}) hit points, to be cured of all diseases, or to be neutralized of all poisons affecting them (the metamorph's choice).

entries: The resopath chooses one creature they can see within 60 feet of them that has a challenge rating of 10 or lower (or that is 10th level or lower, for creatures that don't have a challenge rating), then psionically creates a perfect copy of that creature. The copy has the same statistics as the original creature, except that they have mundane copies of the creature's equipment, and have no lair actions, legendary actions, or villain actions. The copy reflects the original creature's current state, including current hit points and available actions. The copy is loyal to the resopath and understands the commands the resopath gives them through a mental link they share. They disappear when they are reduced to 0 hit points.

While the target is {@condition charmed} in this way, the telepath has a telepathic link with them as long as both are on the same plane of existence. The telepath can use this telepathic link to issue commands to the target (no action required), which the target does their best to obey. If the target completes an order and doesn't receive further direction from the telepath, they defend and preserve themself to the best of their ability.

The telepath can use an action to take total and precise control of a {@condition charmed} target. Until the end of the telepath's next turn, the target takes only the actions the telepath chooses, and doesn't do anything else. During this time, the telepath can also cause the target to use a reaction, but this requires the telepath to use their reaction as well.
Each time the target takes damage, they make a new Wisdom saving throw. If the saving throw succeeds, the {@condition charmed} condition ends.

reaction.name: Share Pain (2nd-Order Power)
entries: When the telepath is damaged by a creature they can see within 60 feet of them, they force the creature to make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw.
The target takes 6 ({@damage 1d12}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Powers
headerEntries: In addition to the other powers in this stat block, the telepath can manifest the following powers, using Intelligence as their manifestation ability (power save {@dc 13}):

action.name: Psychic Stab (1st-Order Power)
entries: One creature the telepath can see within 120 feet of them must succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 3d10}) psychic damage.

action.name: Dagger of the Mind (3/Day; 4th-Order Power)
entries: The telepath chooses one creature they can see within 60 feet of them, which must make a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) psychic damage and can take only the Dash, Disengage, or Dodge actions on their next turn. On a success, the target takes half as much damage and can take their turn normally.

action.name: Fracture (1/Day; 5th-Order Power)
entries: Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within 90 feet of the telepath must make a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 27 ({@damage 6d8}) psychic damage and is fractured for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't fractured.
While fractured, a creature's speed is halved; they have disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws; and attack rolls against them have advantage.

action.name: Harlequin (1/Day; 4th-Order Power; Concentration)
entries: The telepath chooses one Humanoid they can see within 120 feet of them, which must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the telepath for 1 hour. While the target is {@condition charmed} in this way, the telepath has a telepathic link with them as long as both are on the same plane of existence.

They can use this telepathic link to issue commands to the target (no action required), which the target does their best to obey. If the target completes an order and doesn't receive further direction from the telepath, they defend and preserve themself to the best of their ability.

The telepath can use an action to take total and precise control of a {@condition charmed} target. Until the end of the telepath's next turn, the target takes only the actions the telepath chooses, and doesn't do anything else. During this time, the telepath can also cause the target to use a reaction, but this requires the telepath to use their reaction as well.
Each time the target takes damage, they make a new Wisdom saving throw. If the saving throw succeeds, the {@condition charmed} condition ends.

reaction.name: Share Pain (3rd-Order Power)
entries: When the telepath is damaged by a creature they can see within 60 feet of them, they force the creature to make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw.
The target takes 13 ({@damage 2d12}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

On a success, the target takes half as much damage and can take their turn normally.
